original: Bursie, Klas, major. Karlsborg, f. 11/7/94 i Oslo, Norge, av överste Herman B. o. Christine Heftye. — Stud:-ex. i Skara 15, off:ex. 17, AIHS 19, SS 23, tygoff:kurs 25, art. skjutsk. 32. Fänr. v. Göta art:reg. 17, kapt. 32, major v. Fälttygkår. 40. Chef f. Karlsborgs tygstation fr. 38. Ordf. i Karls-borgs fältrittkl. 39-46, i jaktv:fören. fr. 38. Hobbies: ridn., skytte, jakt, segl., trädg:arb. RSO, FFrK4klmisv, ChrX:sFrM, Skytite:M.
translated: Bursie, Klas, Major. Karlsborg, born on July 11th, 1894 in Oslo, Norway, to Colonel Herman B. and Christine Heftye. He passed his studentexamen (the final exam in upper-secondary school) in Skara in 1915, officer's exam in 1917, attended an artillery and engineering school (Artilleri- och ingenjörhögskolan, AIHS) in 1919, attended the Staff School (Krigshögskolan, SS) in 1923, took a course in textile engineering in 1925, and trained as an artillerist in 1932. He started as a second lieutenant in Göta artillery regiment in 1917, was promoted to captain in 1932, and became a major in the Field Artillery Corps in 1940. He was the head of the Karlsborg textile station from 1938. He was the chairman of the Karlsborg equestrian club from 1939-1946 and the hunting association from 1938. His hobbies were horseback riding, shooting, hunting, sailing, and gardening. He received several military awards, including the Royal Swedish Order of the Sword (RSO), the Knight of the Order of the Polar Star (FFrK4klmisv), the Commander of the Order of the Cross of Liberty (ChrX:sFrM), and the Shooting Medal (Skytite:M).

awards.name: Royal Swedish Order of the Sword
Knight of the Order of the Polar Star
Commander of the Order of the Cross of Liberty
